title: Tesla fired employees for union efforts, workers’ group says
description: Tesla Workers United said employees were fired in 'retaliation for union activity' and to 'discourage' it.

title: UN launches $1bn appeal for earthquake aid operations in Turkey
description: After launching a $400m appeal for Syrians, the UN has now appealed for funds for the Turkish relief operation.

title: Biden says flying objects likely tied to private sector, research
description: US president says objects shot down over North America do not appear to be linked to alleged Chinese 'spy' balloon.

title: Family of man killed after police tasing calls for accountability
description: Darryl Tyree Williams, an African American, told police he had a heart problem during an arrest. They tased him anyway.

title: US pledges more support after Ohio toxic train spill
description: Residents of East Palestine, Ohio, are demanding answers amid fears over health effects of toxic chemical spill.

title: Tesla to recall 362,000 US vehicles on full self-driving software
description: Software allows vehicles to 'exceed speed limits or travel through intersections in an unlawful' manner, says regulator.

title: Could bird flu become a pandemic?
description: Several countries have reported an outbreak and global concern is growing.

title: Libraries address ‘gaps’ in California housing, weather response
description: As droughts, fire and severe storms ravage the western United States, local libraries offer sanctuary to those in need.

title: Russia rains missiles on Ukraine, eyes Bakhmut capture in April
description: Wagner head Yevgeny Prigozhin forecast Bakhmut would fall by April, blaming delays on the Russian military bureaucracy.

title: Balloons, ‘objects’ – what’s in the sky above the US?
description: US airspace is increasingly crowded, not all regulated, and with so much up there, it's not easy to track it all.

title: US labour market remains tight, monthly producer prices rise
description: The reports are stoking concerns that the US Fed will continue raising interest rates to battle inflation.

title: Trump election probe: Some witnesses may have lied, panel finds
description: Special grand jury investigating Donald Trump's push to overturn 2020 vote in Georgia says there was no election fraud.

title: As cash runs out, Pakistan introduces bill to unlock IMF funds
description: Measures proposed to secure the crucial loan include raising the general sales tax by a percentage point to 18 percent.

title: Syrian refugees return home from Turkey after quake devastation
description: Syrians are hoping conditions in their war-ravaged homeland are better than Turkey.

title: Turkey and Syria face long road to recovery after earthquakes
description: After February 6 quakes, efforts are now concentrated on demolishing damaged buildings and clearing rubble and debris.

title: Who could be Nigeria’s next president? | Start Here
description: Why this presidential election is looking very different from previous ones.

title: Ethiopian Orthodox Church reaches deal with three rogue bishops
description: A deal was sealed in the presence of Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed to reinstate the three rogue clerics into the church.

title: Spain approves menstrual leave, teen abortion and trans laws
description: Measures allow workers suffering period pain to take paid time off as abortion rights are expanded.

title: A year into the Ukraine war, Russians quietly call for peace
description: Russians are finding subtle ways to express dissent over the Kremlin's offensive in Ukraine despite the threat of jail.

title: Sturgeon leaves her party and movement in a state of uncertainty
description: As Nicola Sturgeon prepares to leave Holyrood, Scotland's independence dream is slowly fading away.

title: Russia surrounds Bakhmut as Ukraine sends in troops
description: What happened in the 51st week of Russia's war in Ukraine?

title: Where does your country stand on the Russia-Ukraine war?
description: Al Jazeera breaks down the political, military and economic positions of various countries around the world.

title: Our ‘father’ has finally been released from Guantanamo
description: But like all former detainees, including myself, father Saifullah is not truly free.

title: Israel passes law allowing deportation of Palestinian prisoners
description: New law will make it easier for Israel to revoke citizenship and residency of Palestinians in Israel and East Jerusalem.

title: China calls for Iran sanctions to be lifted during Raisi’s visit
description: Beijing has condemned the punitive economic measures during Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi's first state visit.

title: Can racism be rooted out of US law enforcement?
description: After young Black man Tyre Nichols was killed by police, there are renewed calls to reform law enforcement in the US.

title: Nigeria’s Buhari extends deadline to turn in old banknotes
description: A note swap scheme has led to cash shortages across the country as Nigeria heads for elections on February 25.

title: Armenia offers peace treaty project to Azerbaijan
description: The agreement would provide for monitoring mechanisms designed to prevent war in the Nagorno-Karabakh region.

title: ‘Life is over’: A newspaper’s death near Turkey quake epicentre
description: In a city with more than 450 deaths, a newspaper's last edition bears testimony to life before it was forever upended.

title: China sanctions Lockheed Martin, Raytheon over Taiwan arms sales
description: China's commerce ministry said the US firms were put on an 'unreliable entities list' owing to weapons sales to Taiwan.

title: Rwanda accuses DR Congo soldiers of attack on border army post
description: DRC authorities have denied its soldiers entered a neutral zone and opened fire on Rwanda's troops.

title: S Korea defence paper says N Korea increased plutonium stockpile
description: North Korea increased its stockpile of weapons-grade plutonium from 50kg to 70kg, South Korea's defence paper says.

title: Middle East round-up: Turkey, Syria earthquake survivors in need
description: Here's a round-up of Al Jazeera's Middle East coverage this week.

title: A year of Russia’s war in Ukraine: Your simple guide
description: Ukraine says a renewed Russian offensive is under way following 12 months of bloodshed.

title: Indonesia military court sentences 4 soldiers over Papua killings
description: Four Papuan men were killed and their bodies mutilated after a deal to buy arms from the Indonesian troops fell apart.

title: North Korea’s Kim Jong-un breaks ground for apartments, farm
description: North Korean leader attends groundbreaking ceremonies amid concerns for isolated country's food situation.

title: Nigeria election: Women denounce poor political representation
description: Half of Nigeria's population are women but only 4 percent were elected into government in 2019. Will 2023 be different?

description: Speed of aid deliveries to Syria criticised as 5.3 million are left homeless

title: Will bird flu spark the next pandemic?
description: It is rising fast as a contender amid dramatic outbreaks among mammals, and could be far deadlier than COVID-19.

title: Cyclone Gabrielle: New Zealand ‘open’ to international assistance
description: Five people are dead and 100 missing after the storm battered the North Island, home to most of the population.

title: Petronas units in Luxembourg ordered seized in colonial-era row
description: Luxembourg court bailiffs issue new seizure orders for units of Malaysian state oil firm in long-running land dispute.

title: Chinese retirees take to streets over plan to cut health benefits
description: Hundreds of elderly people marched in the cities of Wuhan and Dalian despite heavy security presence.

title: Nicaragua strips 94 political opponents of citizenship
description: Analysts, legal experts and human rights groups condemn the move, which they say violates international law.

title: World Bank head criticised over climate stance to step down early
description: David Malpass led lender through crises including the war in Ukraine but faced criticism over stance on climate change.

title: Newly released footage shows wreckage of the ‘unsinkable’ Titanic
description: Timed to the 25th anniversary of the film Titanic, the release offers a look at one of the earliest dives to the wreck.

title: US Republicans subpoena Big Tech CEOs over censorship claims
description: House Judiciary Committee writes to top Silicon Valley executives amid claims conservative speech is being suppressed.

title: Cambodia placed on watchlist of ‘repressive’ states: CIVICUS
description: Cambodia's longtime ruler Hun Sen has 'overseen a systematic assault on fundamental freedoms', report states.
